meanings.definition: To be subjected to the action of an anvil.
meanings.sent1: The metal was anviled by the blacksmith.
meanings.sent2: The sword was anviled into shape by the skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome anviled a tiny horseshoe for his pet mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her determination anviled her through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The thunder anviled through the quiet night, waking everyone up.

meanings.definition: To be shaped or formed on an anvil.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith anviled the hot iron into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The horseshoe was anviled perfectly to fit the horse's hoof.
meanings.sent3: The chef anviled the dough into a perfect circle for the pie crust.
meanings.sent4: His words anviled a lasting impression in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The artist anviled his emotions into the metal, creating a masterpiece.
